pages.content: Tyrannosaurus rex| was one of| the most| famous dinosaurs.| It| lived| from| 68| to| 65| million| years ago.
The name| “Tyrannosaurus rex”| means| “tyrant lizard king”.| We call it| T – Rex| for short.
T-Rex| lived in| forests.| It usually| stayed| close to| rivers.
How big| was| the Tyrannosaurus| rex?| It was| one of| the largest| of the land| predator| dinosaurs.| The T-Rex| measured| up to| 13 meters long| and weighed| as much as| 7.5 tons.
T-Rex| walked and ran| on two legs.| These two legs| were large| and strong.| In contrast,| the arms of the T-Rex| were| relatively| small.
T-Rex| had| a massive| skull.| Their| skulls| have| been| found| that are| as long as| 1.5 meters!
It| also| had very| large| teeth| and strong| jaws.
T-Rex| ate meat| to survive.| It| used| its jaws| and teeth| to eat| smaller| dinosaurs.
Scientists| have found| hundreds of| T-Rex fossils.| They have| learned| about| the T-Rex| by studying| fossils.
One of| the largest| and most| complete| is "Sue".| You can see “Sue”| at The Field Museum| in Chicago,| United States.
